derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: via late Latin from Greek huphen 'together', from hupo 'under' + hen 'one'

entry.def: A hyphen is the punctuation sign used to join words together to make a compound, as in 'left-handed'. People also use a hyphen to show that the rest of a word is on the next line.

means.word_mean: 1. a punctuation mark (-) used between parts of a compound word or between the syllables of a word when the word is divided at the end of a line of text
1. divide or connect with a hyphen;

sentences.en: There are no hard and fast rules about the use of hyphens in English.
